snippet: The de Blasio administration is seeking a deal with the union that would let New York City stretch out potentially huge retroactive pay raises.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is pushing for a record nine-year contract with the teacher's union that would allow city to stretch out potentially huge retroactive pay increases; administration has said city cannot afford to immediately pay $3.4 billion that union has demanded; contract is likely to set pattern for city's other municipal unions, which are also demanding billions in retroactive raises, making negotiations all the more tricky.
lead_paragraph: The de Blasio administration is seeking a deal with the union that would let New York City stretch out potentially huge retroactive pay raises.

headline.main: De Blasio Pushes a 9-Year Contract for Teachers
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Pushes a 9-Year Contract for Teachers
